alert.note: Alert for Marion; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 11:17PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Walker, southeastern Marion and Winston Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1117 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brushy Lake to near Lynn to near Sulligent. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Lynn, Arley, Guin, Double Springs, Brilliant, Addison, Glen Allen, Nauvoo, Gu- Win, Eldridge, Houston Recreational Area, Camp McDowell, Nesmith, Ashbank, Brushy Lake, Poplar Springs, Ashridge, Falls City and Lake Buttahatchee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for central, northwestern and west central Alabama.
